definition.name: NXspm
definition.doc:
Scanning Probe Microscopy (SPM) is a branch of microscopy that utilizes a physical probe to scan the surface of sample and image it at the atomic level.
The application class NXspm is designed as a skeleton and contains common technical concepts for specific SPM sub-techniques such as STM, STS, AFM etc. In addition, it can be utilized to describe the SPM experiments without further specialization for each sub-technique.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Name of the definition that is used for the application.

field.name: experiment_technique
field.doc: The technique of the experiment like STM, STS, AFM.

field.name: scan_mode
field.doc:
The mode of the scan. The possible options depend on the type of experiment. For example, in STM, the scan mode could be constant height or constant current, in AFM, the scan mode could be contact mode, tapping mode or non-contact mode.
For general purpose usage, all scan modes from its sub-techniques are listed.

field.name: scan_type
field.doc: The type of the scan. It mainly describes how scan probe moves in the scan region, e.g. forward, backward, or both (if scan is repeated). Any lab defined scan type

field.name: identifier_experiment
field.doc: The identifier for the experiment which should be unique at least in lab.

group.doc: Define data processing (e.g., data analysis, image processing) program and associated workflow, software and store results.

group.name: hardware
group.doc: The hardware description of core instrument setup of experiment. Usually, the entire instrument is supplied by a single manufacturer. To describe the hardware from any sub-components, use the ``hardware`` group of that sub-component (child group of the NXinstrument group) group.

field.name: name
field.doc: Name of the hardware.

field.name: vendor
field.doc: Company name of the manufacturer.

field.name: model
field.doc: Version or model of the hardware setup provided by the manufacturer.

group.name: software
group.doc: The software description of core instrument setup of experiment. Usually, the entire instrument is supplied by a single name/manufacturer/model/etc. To describe the software from any sub-components, use the ``software`` group of that component.

field.name: name
field.doc: Name of the software.

field.name: vendor
field.doc: Company name of the manufacturer.

field.name: model
field.doc: Version or model of the component named by the manufacturer.

group.name: lockin_amplifier
group.doc: The lock-in amplifier information.

field.name: flip_sign
field.doc: The sign (1 or -1) that renders the values of the lock-in current positive. The calibration procedure with retracted tip is normally performed to compensate for the signal phase delay in SPM. The procedure yields two possible solutions corresponding to the chosen phase, this number should be equal to 1 or -1 depending on which solution is chosen (this concept mainly used in STS experiments).

field.name: active_channel
field.doc: The name of the active channel of the lock-in amplifier which is used for the measurement.

group.name: SCAN_ENVIRONMENT
group.doc:
Information of the scan environment holding concept for temperature, setpoint (current or height), scan area and scan data.
Note: At least one field from head_temperature, cryo_bottom_temperature and cryo_shield_temperature must be provided.

field.name: head_temperature
field.doc: Temperature (stabilized or target value) of STM head. For array data of head_temperature, use head_temperature_sensor group.

field.name: identifier_environment
field.doc: Unique identifier for the scan environment defined by the user or lab. When multiple scans are performed in a single environment conditions or settings, the entire scan environment can be differentiated by this identifier. For example, scan on a sample of TiSe2 with layered of evaporated pyrene and annealed at 300K temperature for 5 min process.

field.name: cryo_bottom_temperature
field.doc: Temperature (stabilized or targeted single value) of the cold tail of the cryostat. For array data of cryo_bottom_temperature, use cryo_bottom_temperature_sensor group.

field.name: cryo_shield_temperature
field.doc: Temperature (stabilized or targeted single value) of liquid nitrogen shield. For array data of cryo_shield_temperature, use cryo_shield_temperature_sensor group.

group.name: current_sensorTAG
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/current_sensorTAG

group.name: voltage_sensorTAG
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/voltage_sensorTAG

group.name: piezo_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/piezo_sensor.

group.name: XYZpiezo_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to /entry/instrument/XYZpiezo_sensor.

group.name: height_piezo_sensor
group.doc: This should be a link to the concept entry/instrument/height_piezo_sensor.

The scan control information like scan region or phase space, type of scan (e.g. mesh, spiral, etc.), and scan speed, etc. This group mainly stores the scan settings data. For processed data or final experimental data would go to NXdata group.

field.name: scanTAG
field.doc: If there are multiple scans performed under the same environment, use this field to differentiate among them.

group.name: scan_region
group.doc: The scan region (phase space or sub-phase space) is the region where the scan is performed.

field.name: scan_range_x
field.doc: The range of the scan in x direction.

field.name: scan_range_y
field.doc: The range of the scan in y direction.

field.name: scan_offset_value_x
field.doc: The offset of the scan in x direction.

field.name: scan_offset_value_y
field.doc: The offset of the scan in y direction.

field.name: scan_angle_x
field.doc: The angle of the scan region in x direction.

field.name: scan_angle_y
field.doc: The angle of the scan region in y direction.

field.name: scan_start_x
field.doc: The start of the scan in x direction.

field.name: scan_start_y
field.doc: The start of the scan in y direction.

field.name: scan_end_x
field.doc: The end of the scan in x direction.

field.name: scan_end_y
field.doc: The end of the scan in y direction.

group.name: meshSCAN
group.doc: The mesh scan is a common technique used in SPM to scan the surface of the sample in a grid pattern.

field.name: scan_points_x
field.doc: The number of points scanned in x direction.

field.name: scan_points_y
field.doc: The number of points scanned in y direction.

field.name: step_size_x
field.doc: The step size in x direction.

field.name: step_size_y
field.doc: The step size in y direction.

group.name: current_sensorTAG
group.doc: Information for current sensor. Any current sensor such as a current-voltage transimpedance amplifier involved in the experiment or in any special measurement or in any specialized experiment component can be registered under this group.

field.name: NAMEcurrent
field.doc: The name of the current sensor used for specific measurement or in component.

field.name: current
field.doc: Name of the current according to the purpose of the measurement. E.g., the field can be named as tip_current defining the current measured at the tip.

field.name: offset_value
field.doc: The offset in the tunneling current between tip and sample.

group.name: calibration
group.doc: Calibration data of the current sensor.

field.name: coefficient
field.doc: The coefficient of the calibration.

group.doc: An amplifier information that amplifies the input signal.

field.name: current_gain
field.doc: The gain of the current sensor.

group.name: voltage_sensorTAG
group.doc:
The sensor information for the voltage device. Any voltage sensor involved in the experiment or in any special measurement or in any specialized experiment component can be registered under this group.
For this purpose, replace the TAG with the specific name or ID of the voltage sensor.
Do not register this group for sample bias voltage (DC), for that we have :ref:`sample_bias_voltage </NXspm/entry/instrument/sample_bias_voltage-group>` group.

field.name: NAMEvoltage
field.doc: The name of the voltage according to the purpose of the measurement. E.g., the field can be named as x_source_drain_bias_voltage defining the applied bias along the x-axis as source-drain channel, while current (tip current) will be measured along the z-axis.

field.name: voltage
field.doc: Voltage measured by sensor.

field.name: offset_value
field.doc: The offset voltage. The real voltage is the sum of the voltage and the offset voltage.

group.name: calibration
group.doc: Calibration data of the voltage sensor.

field.name: coefficient
field.doc: The coefficient of the calibration.

group.doc: An amplifier information that amplifies the input signal.

field.name: voltage_gain
field.doc: The gain of the voltage sensor.

group.name: piezo_sensor
group.doc: This piezo sensor group refers to the XYZ (in all directions) piezo sensor.

field.name: x
field.doc: The x position of the piezo.

field.name: y
field.doc: The y position of the piezo.

field.name: z
field.doc: The z position of the piezo.

group.name: height_piezo_sensor
group.doc: The sensor information for the height (Z-axis) piezo device.

group.name: XYZpiezo_sensor
group.doc: For separate piezo sensors along X-, Y-, and Z-axis register this group, e.g., x_piezo_sensor or height_piezo_sensor.

group.name: head_temperature_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the SPM measured near the sample or tip. This group is intended to be used for an array data (e.g., time series).

group.name: cryo_bottom_temperature_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the cold tail of the cryostat. This group is intended to be used for an array data (e.g., time series).

group.name: cryo_shield_temperature_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the liquid nitrogen shield. This group is intended to be used for an array data (e.g., time series).

group.name: sample_temperature_sensor
group.doc: The temperature of the sample. This group is intended to be used for an array data (e.g., time series).

group.name: bias_spectroscopy_environment
group.doc:
To explain bias and current behavior (sweep measurement especially in STS experiment) due to voltage applied to the sample.
In some experiments, e.g., STM, bias spectroscopy could also be part of the measurement setup.
Setup and scan data for continuous measurement of bias voltage on the subject of experiment vs tunneling current from probe.

Information about positioner used in STS scan settings, like PID controller and offset.
Reuse, if needed, this group for positioners for multiple scans at different points on sample.

group.name: BIAS_SWEEP
group.doc: The bias voltage sweep is a common technique used to study properties (in this case current) in the sample or environment due to change in applied bias voltage.

group.name: scan_region
group.doc: The scan region (phase space or sub-phase space) is the region where the scan is performed.

field.name: scan_offset_bias
field.doc: The offset of the bias scan voltage.

group.name: linear_sweep
group.doc: The linear sweep is a common technique used on the substance or sample or environment to study the change in the behavior of the sample or substance or environment due to change in applied bias voltage.

group.name: sample_bias_voltage
group.doc: The DC bias voltage that is applied to the sample (for example in constant- current mode in STM).

field.name: bias_voltage
field.doc: The bias voltage (DC) applied to the sample.

field.name: bias_offset_value
field.doc: Offset value of the bias voltage.

group.name: calibration
group.doc: Calibration of the bias voltage measurement (V/V).

field.name: coefficient
field.doc: The coefficient of the calibration.

group.doc: The sample information.

group.name: history
group.doc: A set of physical processes that occurred to the sample prior/during experiment.

group.name: sample_environment
group.doc: Information of environment around the sample.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: The single-valued temperature of the sample, also referred to as the tip temperature (not head temperature), since the tip and sample are in contact or in close proximity. For array like temperature data use sample_temperature_sensor group.

group.name: sample_bias_voltage
group.doc:
This should be a link to
/entry/instrument/sample_bias_voltage sensor under instrument.

group.name: sample_temperature_sensor
group.doc:
This should be a link to
/entry/instrument/sample_temperature_sensor under instrument.
The data group.

field.name: DATA
field.doc: The data (e.g. current, voltage, temperature) field that can be plotted against the axes.

field.name: AXISNAME
field.doc: The name of the axis that corresponds to the data field.

group.name: reproducibility_indicators
group.doc: The group of indicators (links to the existing fields in different groups) that measure the reproducibility of the experiment.

group.name: LINK_TO_GROUP
group.doc: A place holder to create link to any group relevant considered as reproducibility indicators (defined by laboratory).

field.name: LINK_TO_FIELD
field.doc: A place holder to create link to any field relevant considered as reproducibility indicators (defined by laboratory).

group.name: resolution_indicators
group.doc: The group of indicators (links to the existing fields in different groups) that are used to measure the resolution of the experiment results.

group.name: LINK_TO_GROUP
group.doc: A place holder to create link to any group relevant considered as reproducibility indicators (defined by laboratory).

field.name: LINK_TO_FIELD
field.doc: A place holder to create link to any field relevant considered as reproducibility indicators (defined by laboratory).
